reference_steps: Dissolve NiCl2·6H2O, CoCl2·6H2O, and MnCl2·4H2O in DI water to form a uniform solution.
Add NaOH solution dropwise under vigorous stirring to form a suspension.
Transfer the suspension to a Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave.
Heat the autoclave at 120 °C for 12 hours.
Cool the autoclave to room temperature naturally.
Wash the precipitate with DI water and ethanol multiple times.
Dry the product at 60 °C for 12 hours in a vacuum oven.
test_steps: NiCl2·6H2O, CoCl2·6H2O, and MnCl2·4H2O were dissolved in deionized water.
An aqueous solution of NaOH was added dropwise into the solution with stirring.
The resulting suspension was transferred into a Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave.
The autoclave was heated to 120 °C and maintained for 12 h.
After cooling down to room temperature, the product was washed with deionized water and ethanol.
The final product was dried at 60 °C for 12 h.

reference_steps: High purity chemical powders were weighed stoichiometrically and ball milled for 24 hours at 300 rpm with alumina balls using acetone as mixing media.
Mixed powders were dried in an oven, followed by calcination at 900°C for 3 hours.
Disc-shaped pellets were prepared using ~13 mm diameter under uniaxial pressure of 200 MPa.
Sintering was carried out at 1150-1200°C for 2-4 hours.
For XRD measurements, sintered pellets were grounded and annealed at 500°C for 1 hour to remove any strain.
For electrical property measurement, samples were thinned to ~1 mm and electroded on both sides using silver paste.
Samples were annealed at 500°C for 1 hour after electrode application.
Electrical poling was done by applying DC field of 4-5 kV/mm for 15-30 min in silicone oil bath.
test_steps: Weighed stoichiometrically the chemical powders.
Ball milled for 24 hours at 300 rpm with alumina balls using acetone as mixing media.
Dried the mixed powders in an oven.
Calcined at a temperature of 900°C for 3 hours.
Prepared disc-shaped pellets using approximately 13 mm diameter under a uniaxial pressure of 200 MPa.
Sintered at 1150-1200°C for 2-4 hours.

reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio of (1-x)(0.7BiFeO3-0.3BaTiO3)-x(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3-5 mol% Bi2O3 with x = 0.000, 0.001, 0.002, 0.003.
Materials were processed using traditional solid-state reaction method.
Ceramics were sintered to obtain final products.
Samples were poled for 24 hours at room temperature before electrical measurements.
LNO precursor prepared by dissolving equimolar La(NO3)3 and Ni(NO3)2 in glacial acetic acid with ethylene glycol, stirred for 1 hr.
TiO precursor prepared by dissolving Ti-n-butoxide in glacial acetic acid with ethylene glycol, stirred for 1 hr.
PZT precursor prepared by dissolving Pb(CH3COO)2 in glacial acetic acid, adding Zr(OC4H9)4 and Ti(OC4H9)4 stoichiometrically with distilled water and ethylene glycol.
10 wt% polyvinyl pyrrolidone added to PZT precursor and stirred for 1 hr, then filtered.
Buffer layers deposited by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s on Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate.
Buffer layers annealed at 650°C for 30 mins.
PZT film deposited by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Two-step annealing process: 400°C for 2 mins, then 650°C for 2 mins.
Process repeated for 12 cycles to achieve ~1000 nm thickness.
Final annealing at 650°C for 30 mins in open-air atmosphere.
Pt top electrode deposited by DC sputtering for electrical measurements.
test_steps: Prepare 0.1 M concentration by dissolving equimolar quantity of Lanthanum (III) nitrate and Nickel (II) nitrate in glacial acetic acid and add 0.01 M concentration of ethylene glycol, stir for 1 hr.
Prepare 0.3 M concentration by dissolving Ti-n butoxide in glacial acetic acid, stir for 1 hr, and add 0.01 M concentration of ethylene glycol, stir for 1 hr.
Prepare 0.1 M concentration by dissolving Lead (II) acetate in glacial acetic acid, add stoichiometric concentration of Zirconium (IV) n-butoxide and Titanium (IV) n-butoxide, stir.
Add appropriate amount of distilled water and ethylene glycol, stir for 30 mins.
Add 10 wt% of polyvinyl pyrrolidone, stir for another 1 hr.
Filter using Whatman filter paper prior to deposition.
Prepare buffer layers (TiO, LNO, LNO/TiO) by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s and anneal at 650 °C for 30 mins.
Deposit PZT film by spin coating at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Perform two-step annealing process at 400 °C for 2 mins and 650 °C for 2 mins.
Undergo 12 cycles to achieve desired thickness of ~1000 nm and subsequently anneal at 650 °C for 30 mins.

reference_steps: 1.0 mol% Mn-doped 0.28Pb(In1/2Nb1/2)O3-0.42Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.30PbTiO3 single crystal grown along [001] by modified Bridgman method.
Single crystal cut into 6 × 6 × 0.38 mm³ unit sheets from same horizontal cross-section.
Unit sheets annealed at 600°C for 4 hours and cleaned.
Ultrathin conductive gold layers with 100 nm thickness deposited by sputtering method.
0.5 mm wide insulating margins left on alternating surfaces during electrode plating.
Direct current polarization along [001] direction at 135°C, 1 kV/mm for 10 minutes using CS2674 AX voltage tester in thermostatic oil bath.
15 layers of unit sheets bonded using E-44(6101) epoxy in electrical parallel and mechanical series configuration.
Zirconia ceramic sheets (0.5 mm thickness) affixed to top and bottom surfaces for rigidity.
Stacked samples subjected to 5 MPa pressure longitudinally using isostatic press.
Static curing for 48 hours to obtain final PSAs with dimensions 6 × 6 × 6.7 mm³.
test_steps: Grow the single crystal along [001] direction using the modified Bridgman method.
Cut the grown crystal into unit sheets of dimensions 6 × 6 × 0.38 mm³.
Anneal the unit sheets at 600 °C for 4 hours.
Clean the unit sheets.
Deposit ultrathin conductive gold layers (100 nm) on the surface using a sputtering method.
Leave 0.5 mm wide insulating margins on alternating upper and lower surfaces during electrode plating.
Polarize the unit sheets along the [001] direction using direct current polarization at 135 °C, 1 kV/mm for 10 minutes.
Bond 15 layers of unit sheets using E-44(6101) epoxy in an electrical parallel and mechanical series configuration.
Affix zirconia ceramic sheets (0.5 mm thick) to the top and bottom surfaces for rigidity.
Apply 5 MPa pressure longitudinally using an isostatic press.
Cure the stacked samples statically for 48 hours.
Finish the PSAs with dimensions of 6 × 6 × 6.7 mm³.

reference_steps: K2CO3 and Na2CO3 powders dried at 150°C for 1 h before weighing.
Powders weighed according to compositions (K0.5Na0.5)xEu0.01NbO3 with x = 0.99, 1.00, and 1.01.
Weighed powders milled with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 hours.
Powder mixture dried at 100°C and calcined at 850°C for 4 h.
Polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) added to calcined powder as binder.
Green ceramics prepared by uniaxial pressing into pellets with 1 mm thickness and 10 mm diameter.
Green ceramics covered with same powder prior to sintering to prevent K and Na volatilization.
Ceramics heated to 850°C for 1 h to burn out PVA binder.
Final sintering at 1170°C for 3 h.
Silver paste applied to polished surface (600 μm thickness) followed by baking at 350°C for 30 min for electrical measurements.
Ceramics poled using 30 kV/cm DC electric field for 30 min at room temperature.
test_steps: Dry K2CO3 and Na2CO3 powders at 150 °C for 1 h.
Weigh the powders according to the compositions ((K0.5Na0.5) x Eu0.01NbO3 x = 0.99, 1.00, and 1.01).
Mill the weighed powders with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 hours.
Dry the milled powders at 100 °C.
Calcine the dried powders at 850 °C for 4 h.
Add polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as a binder to the calcined powder.
Prepare green ceramics by uniaxial pressing into pellets with a thickness of 1 mm and a diameter of 10 mm.
Heat the ceramics to 850 °C for 1 h to burn out the PVA binder.
Sinter the ceramics at 1170 °C for 3 h.

reference_steps: Stoichiometric raw materials weighed for (0.994-x)(K0.48Na0.52)(Nb0.97Sb0.03)O3-0.006BiFeO3-xBi0.5Na0.5ZrO3 with x=0-0.12 mol%.
Raw materials ball-milled in alcohol for 24 hours to reduce particle size.
Mixed powder dried in hot air oven at 100°C for 24 h to remove residual alcohol.
Dried powder sieved to ensure uniform particle size and calcined at 900°C for 6 h.
Fine powder pressed into pellets using uniaxial pressing at 100-200 MPa pressure.
Pellets sintered at 1120-1140°C for 3 h.
Sintered pellets divided into two portions: one polished and ground into fine particles for composite film fabrication.
Other portion polished and painted with silver paste electrodes for electrical property testing.
For composite films: KNNS-BF-3BNZ ceramic powder dispersed in ethyl alcohol using sonication for 3 h.
Dispersed powder mixed with PDMS in various proportions (0-30 wt%) and combined with curing agent (10:1 ratio).
Mixture loaded into syringe and poured into prepared mold, placed at room temperature for 48 hours.
Dried KNNS-BF-3BNZ/PDMS film cut into 3×3 cm sheets with 3 mm thickness.
test_steps: Weigh stoichiometric raw materials.
Ball-mill the mixed powder in alcohol for 24 hours.
Dry the mixed powder in a hot air oven at around 100°C for 24 hours.
Sieve the dried powder to ensure uniform particle size.
Calcine the powder at 900°C for 6 hours.
Press the fine powder into pellets using uniaxial pressing at 100-200 MPa.
Sinter the pellets at 1120-1140°C for 3 hours.
Disperse the ceramic powder in ethyl alcohol using sonication for 3 hours.
Mix the dispersed powder with PDMS in various proportions and combine with curing agent.
Pour the mixture into a prepared mold and let it sit at room temperature for 48 hours.
Cut the dried composite film into sheets of 3x3 cm and 3 mm thickness.

reference_steps: Powders of PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, Sm2O3, and Ta2O5 weighed according to [Pb0.09Sm0.01][(Zr0.54Ti0.46)1-xTax]O3 stoichiometry with x = 0, 0.01, 0.02, and 0.03.
Weighed powders subjected to wet-ball milling for 8 h.
Milled powders calcined at 850°C for 2 h.
Calcined powder sintered between 1150-1200°C for 2 h.
Ceramics coated with silver electrodes.
Poling performed in silicone oil at 150°C under 3 kV/mm electric field for 0.5 h.
test_steps: Weigh the powders of PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, Sm2O3, and Ta2O5 by the required molar proportions.
Subject the weighed powders to wet-ball milling for 8 hours.
Calcine the milled powders at a temperature of 850 °C for 2 hours.
Sinter the calcined powders between 1150 and 1200 °C for 2 hours.
Coat the ceramics with silver.
Pole the ceramics in silicone oil at 150 °C under 3 kV/mm for 0.5 hours.

reference_steps: High-purity MgO and Nb2O5 powders mixed and calcined at 1100°C for 5 hours to produce columbite precursor MgNb2O6.
MgNb2O6 precursor mixed with PbO, TiO2, Sm2O3, and Pr6O11 for 2.5 mol% Sm/Pr co-doped 0.72PMN-0.28PT composition.
Mixed powders calcined at 800°C for 3 hours to generate PMN-PT powder.
PMN-PT powders pressed into 13 mm-diameter cylinders by uniaxial dry pressing.
Cylinders first sintered in oxygen atmosphere at 1200-1240°C.
Second sintering performed under uniaxial pressure of 100 MPa to improve density and eliminate porosity.
For electrical measurements, samples polished to 0.6-0.7 mm thickness.
Platinum electrodes sputtered on both surfaces.
Samples poled under DC field of 10 kV/cm for 20 minutes.
test_steps: Mix and calcine MgO and Nb2O5 at 1100°C for 5 hours to produce precursor columbite.
Mix MgNb2O6, PbO, TiO2, Sm2O3, and Pr6O11 and calcine at 800°C for 3 hours to generate PMN-PT powder.
Press PMN-PT powders into 13 mm-diameter cylinders by uniaxial dry pressing.
Sinter the cylinders in an oxygen atmosphere at 1200-1240°C.
Sinter under a uniaxial pressure of 100 MPa to improve densities and eliminate porosity.

reference_steps: Raw powders La2O3 and Nb2O5 mixed at mass ratio 3:2 and ball-milled in ethanol for 12 hours to prepare LN additive.
LN mixture sieved to prepare the additive.
High-purity raw powders PbO, TiO2, ZrO2, Bi2O3, and La2O3 weighed based on 0.3PT-0.65PZ-0.05BLZT formula.
Mixed powders combined with ethanol and ball-milled for 16 hours.
Mixtures dried in oven at 80°C for 1-2 hours and calcined at 820°C for 2 hours.
Synthesized powders weighed based on PT-PZ-BLZT-xLN formula (x = 0, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 wt%).
Secondary ball milling, drying, and sieving processes performed.
Granulated powders pressed into 12 mm thick sheets with 5% polyvinyl alcohol binder.
Sheets sintered at 600°C for 4 hours to remove binder.
Final sintering at 1230°C for 2 hours to synthesize ceramic samples.
Ceramic surfaces polished to uniform thickness of approximately 0.3 mm.
Silver electrodes applied to ceramic sheets for electrical measurements.
test_steps: Mix raw powders of La2O3 and Nb2O5 at a mass ratio of 3:2 and ball-mill in ethanol for 12 hours to prepare LN additive.
Weigh high-purity raw powders of PbO, TiO2, ZrO2, Bi2O3, and La2O3 based on the 0.3PT–0.65PZ–0.05BLZT formula.
Combine mixed powders with ethanol and ball-mill for 16 hours.
Dry the mixtures in an oven at 80 °C for 1–2 hours.
Calcine the dried mixtures at 820 °C for 2 hours.
Weigh synthesized powders based on the PT–PZ–BLZT–xLN formula and perform secondary ball milling, drying, and sieving.
Press granulated powders into 12 mm thick sheets with 5% polyvinyl alcohol.
Sinter the sheets at 600 °C for 4 hours to remove the binder.
Sinter the samples at 1230 °C for 2 hours to synthesize ceramic samples.
Polish the ceramic surfaces to maintain a uniform thickness of approximately 0.3 mm.

reference_steps: Raw materials Bi2O3, Fe2O3, BaCO3, TiO2 weighed for 0.69BiFeO3-0.31BaTiO3 composition.
Separate preparation of (0.8BNT-0.2BKT) using same solid-state method.
Weighed powders ground with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 h.
Powder mixture dried at 100°C for 12 h.
Powder calcined in air at 760°C for 6 h at heating rate of 2°C per minute.
8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) added to powder as binder.
Powder pressed under uniaxial pressure of 10 MPa to form discs with 8 mm diameter.
Samples sintered at 600°C for 3 h to remove PVA binder.
Final sintering at 970°C for 6 h.
Silver paste applied to surfaces and fired at 450°C for 30 min.
Silver-plated ceramic samples polarized in silicone oil at 110°C for 15 min using DC field of 5 kV/cm.
test_steps: Weighed powder was ground with zirconia balls in ethanol for 24 h.
Dried at 100 °C for 12 h.
Calcined in air at 760 °C for 6 h at a rate of 2 °C per minute.
Added 8 wt% of polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as a binder and pressed under uniaxial pressure of 10 MPa to form discs with a diameter of 8 mm.
Sintered at 970 °C for 6 h.
Sintered at 600 °C for 3 h to remove the PVA.
Applied silver paste to the surfaces and fired at 450 °C for 30 min.
Polarized in silicone oil at 110 °C for 15 min using a DC field of 5 kV/cm.

reference_steps: Raw materials Bi2O3, TiO2, Fe2O3, and Yb2O3 weighed in stoichiometric ratios for Bi5-xYbxTi3FeO15 compositions with x = 0.00, 0.02, 0.04, 0.06, 0.08, 0.10, 0.15, and 0.20.
Raw materials mixed and milled with ZrO2 balls in ethanol for 12 h.
After drying, mixture calcined at 750°C for 3 h to synthesize target product.
Calcined mixture ground, milled, and dried again under same conditions.
Resulting powder granulated with polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binders.
Powder pressed into disks 12 mm in diameter and 1.0 mm in thickness.
Each disk heated at 650°C to burn off PVA binder.
Final sintering at 1050-1060°C for 3 h at heating rate of 3°C/min in aluminum oxide crucible.
For electrical measurements, silver electrodes screen-printed on both surfaces of polished samples.
Silver electrodes fired at 570°C for 20 min.
Samples poled in silicone oil under DC electric field of 60-70 kV/cm at 150°C for 20 min.
test_steps: Weigh the raw materials in stoichiometric ratios.
Mix and mill the raw materials with ZrO2 balls in ethanol for 12 hours.
Dry the mixture.
Calcine the mixture at 750 °C for 3 hours.
Granulate the resulting powder with polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binders.
Press the granulated powder into disks of 12 mm diameter and 1.0 mm thickness.
Heat each disk at 650 °C to burn off the PVA binder.
Sinter the disks at 1050–1060 °C for 3 hours at a heating rate of 3 °C/min.

reference_steps: High purity ZnO and Nb2O5 used to synthesize ZnNb2O6 precursor at 1000°C.
ZnNb2O6 precursor mixed with high purity Pb3O4, HfO2, and TiO2 for Pb(Zn1/3Nb2/3)x(Hf0.49Ti0.51)1-xO3 compositions with 0.05≤x≤0.20.
Mixture ball milled to ensure homogeneity.
Ball-milled powder calcined at 850°C for 2 h.
Calcined powder pressed into pellets.
Pellets sintered at 1050°C for 2 h to form corresponding ceramics.
For electrical measurements, silver electrodes applied to upper and lower surfaces.
Ceramics with silver electrodes placed in silicone oil at 120°C.
Poling performed under electric field of 4 kV/mm for 30 min.
test_steps: Synthesize ZnNb2O6 precursor at 1000 °C using ZnO and Nb2O5.
Ball mill the mixture of ZnNb2O6 with Pb3O4, HfO2, and TiO2.
Calcine the mixture at 850 °C for 2 hours.
Press and sinter at 1050 °C for 2 hours to form the ceramics.

reference_steps: High-purity raw materials Bi2O3, WO3, Nb2O5, and TiO2 weighed for Bi3Ti(1.5-x)NbxW0.5O9 compositions with x = 0.00, 0.01, 0.02, 0.04, 0.06.
Raw materials ball milled and crushed with zirconia balls using anhydrous ethanol as medium.
Mass ratio of raw material:ball mill media:anhydrous ethanol was 1:2:1.5.
Ball milling conducted for 24 h.
Samples pre-sintered at 800°C with holding time of 2 h.
Powder pelletized with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
Material aged for 24 hours, then subjected to pressure of 16 MPa.
Debinding process performed to remove PVA.
Final sintering conducted in muffle furnace at temperatures between 1010-1030°C.
For electrical measurements, samples coated with silver on both sides to form electrodes.
Samples placed in silicone oil at 160°C and subjected to DC field of 11-18 kV/mm for 30 min for poling.
test_steps: Ball milling and crushing with zirconia balls and anhydrous ethanol as the media
Pre-firing at 800 °C with a holding time of 2 h
Pelletising with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA)
Subjecting to a pressure of 16 MPa and subsequently debonding
Sintering at temperatures between 1010 and 1030 °C

method.reference: molten salt method and templated grain growth (TGG)

reference_steps: [001]-oriented BTO template powders synthesized from Bi2O3 and TiO2 using molten salt method with equal molar ratio of NaCl and KCl in 1:1 wt ratio.
Template powder sintered at 1100°C for 1 h.
BTO matrix powders prepared by solid-state reaction with Bi2O3 and TiO2 weighed according to stoichiometric ratio.
Raw materials calcined at 700°C for 2 h.
Calcined powder ball milled for 48-72 h to achieve small particle size.
Template and matrix powders mixed by ball milling at ~60 rpm using xylene and ethanol as solvents.
5 vol% BTO template added to solution and stirred for 1 h to ensure homogenization.
Tape casting performed with blade gap of 210 μm.
After drying at room temperature for 8-10 h, tapes cut into 10 × 10 mm squares.
Squares laminated under pressure of 75 MPa for 1-3 h.
Organics burned off at 600°C for 3 h.
Green bodies heated in tube furnace from 650°C to 1000°C at rate of 10°C/min for texture evolution assessment.
Green bodies sintered in oxygen atmosphere at 950°C for 0-6 h for electrical property measurements.
test_steps: Synthesize BTO template powders from Bi2O3 and TiO2 using the molten salt method with NaCl and KCl.
Sinter the template powder at 1100 °C for 1 h.
Prepare BTO matrix powders by solid-state reaction with Bi2O3 and TiO2 according to stoichiometric ratio.
Calcine raw materials at 700 °C for 2 h.
Ball mill calcined powder for 48h–72h to achieve small particle size.
Mix template and matrix powders by ball milling at ~60 rpm using xylene and ethanol as solvents.
Add 5 vol% of BTO template to the solution and stir for 1 h.
Perform tape casting with a blade gap of 210 μm.
Dry tapes at room temperature for 8–10 h.
Cut tapes into 10 × 10 mm squares and laminate under 75 MPa for 1–3 h.
Burn off organics at 600 °C for 3 h.
Heat green bodies in a tube furnace from 650 °C to 1000 °C at 10 °C/min.
Sinter green bodies in an oxygen atmosphere at 950 °C for 0–6 h.

reference_steps: Raw materials CaCO3, Na2CO3, Pr6O11, CeO2, Bi2O3, and TiO2 weighed according to stoichiometric composition for Ca1−x(Na0.5Pr0.25Ce0.25)xBi4Ti4O15 with x = 0, 0.05, 0.10, 0.15, and 0.20.
Powders ground using planetary ball mill for 12 h with anhydrous ethanol as solvent.
Ball-milling mixture dried at 70°C for 6 h.
Dried powders calcined for 4 h at 850°C.
0.2 wt% MnO2 added to calcined powders.
Calcined powders ground using planetary ball mill for 12 h and dried again.
6 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder added to calcined powders.
Powders pressed into discs under pressure of 6-8 MPa.
Discs heated at 600°C for 2 h to remove PVA.
Pellets sintered at 950-1050°C for 2.5 h in air.
During sintering, discs covered by their powders in sealed alumina crucibles to reduce volatility of Bi and Na.
For electrical measurements, samples poled in silicone oil bath at 180°C under DC electric field of 14-16 kV/mm for 30 min.
test_steps: The raw materials were ground using a planetary ball mill for 12 h.
Anhydrous ethanol was used as the solvent.
The ball-milling mixture was dried at 70 °C for 6 h.
The dried powders were calcined for 4 h at 850 °C.
0.2 wt% MnO2 was added to the calcined powders.
The calcined powders were ground using the planetary ball mill for 12 h and dried again.
A 6 wt% polyvinyl alcohol binder (PVA) was added to the calcined powders.
The powders were pressed into discs under a pressure of 6–8 MPa.
The discs were heated at 600 °C for 2 h to remove the PVA.
The pellets were sintered at 950 °C-1050 °C for 2.5 h in the air.

reference_steps: Raw materials Pb3O4, SrCO3, MgO, Nb2O5, TiO2, and ZrO2 mixed according to stoichiometric ratio and accurately weighed.
Materials ball milled for 18 h.
Dried powder calcined at 850°C for 3 h.
MnCO3 added to calcined powder with Mn content x ranging from 0 to 0.8 in 0.2 increments.
Ball milled for 18 h after MnCO3 addition.
Polyvinyl butyral used as binder to press dried powder into disks with 10 mm diameter.
Organics removed at 600°C for 3 h.
Green discs sintered at 1150-1250°C for 3 h.
For electrical measurements, both sides of sintered samples coated with silver electrodes and held at 550°C for 30 min.
Ceramics polarized in 150°C silicone oil with DC electric field of 3 kV/mm for 35 min.
test_steps: Mix raw materials according to stoichiometric ratio and accurately weigh.
Ball mill the mixture for 18 hours.
Calcine the dried powder at 850 °C for 3 hours.
Add MnCO3 and ball mill for another 18 hours.
Use polyvinyl butyral as a binder to press the dried powder into disks with a diameter of 10 mm.
Remove organics at 600 °C for 3 hours.
Sinter the green discs at 1150–1250 °C for 3 hours.
Coat both sides of the sintered circular sample with silver electrodes and hold at 550 °C for 30 minutes.
Polarize the ceramics in silicone oil at 150 °C with a direct current electric field of 3 kV/mm for 35 minutes.

reference_steps: Precursors bismuth(III) nitrate pentahydrate, sodium acetate, potassium acetate, titanium(IV) butoxide, and manganese(II) acetate mixed in stoichiometric ratios for 3 mol% Mn-doped 0.8(Bi0.5Na0.5)TiO3–0.2(Bi0.5K0.5)TiO3.
Propan-2-ol and acetic acid used as solvents, with pentane-2,4-dione as polymerizing agent.
Mixture stirred at room temperature at 700 rpm.
Formamide added last for drying control.
Final 0.3 M solution allowed to polymerize for seven days before deposition.
6 layers of BNKT-20-3M deposited on commercial Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate via spin-coating.
Each layer spin-coated at 500 rpm for 10 s, then at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Heat treatments applied after each layer: evaporation at 200°C, pyrolysis at 500°C, and annealing at 750°C, each for 5 min.
After annealing, layer subjected to either fast quenching in liquid nitrogen (LNQ) or air-cooling (AC) to room temperature.
Process repeated 6 times to obtain thin-film sample approximately 220 nm thick.
Some samples further heat-treated in nitrogen atmosphere at 1 atm, 750°C for 30 min for defect passivation.
Circular Pt top electrodes with area of 0.283 mm² deposited by RF magnetron sputtering to create metal-insulator-metal structure.
test_steps: Mix precursors in stoichiometric ratios.
Stir the mixture at room temperature at 700 rpm.
Allow the final 0.3 M solution to polymerize for seven days.
Deposit thin-film samples on Pt/Ti/SiO2/Si substrate via spin-coating.
Spin each layer at 500 rpm for 10 s and then at 4000 rpm for 30 s.
Apply heat treatments: evaporation at 200 °C, pyrolysis at 500 °C, and annealing at 750 °C, each for 5 min.
Repeat the sequence 6 times to achieve a thickness of approximately 220 nm.
Further heat-treat some samples in a nitrogen atmosphere at 750 °C for 30 min for defect passivation.
Deposit circular Pt top electrodes by RF magnetron sputtering.

reference_steps: Yb2O3, MgO and Nb2O5 were used to synthesize fine YbNbO4 and MgNb2O6 precursors.
Stoichiometric PbO, TiO2, MnO2, YbNbO4 and MgNb2O6 precursors were ball-milled in ethanol with ZrO2 media.
The mixture was calcined at 775°C for 2h followed by ball milling again.
BaTiO3 platelets prepared by topochemical microcrystal conversion were used as templates.
Organic binders and solvents were mixed with the fine matrix and ball-milled.
3 vol% BT templates were added into the slurry.
The slurry was di-aired and tape-casted by a doctor blade.
The dried tapes were cut, stacked and laminated into blocks.
After binders burning out, green samples were cold isostatic pressed at 200 MPa.
Textured ceramics were sintered between 1150 and 1200°C for 6h.
To avoid lead volatilization, samples were embedded in coarse matrix powders with same compositions during sintering process.
test_steps: Prepare 0.16PYN-0.52PMN-0.32PT powder doped with 0.5 wt% MnO2 using the two-step columbite precursor method.
Synthesize fine YbNbO4 and MgNb2O6 precursors from Yb2O3, MgO, and Nb2O5.
Ball-mill stoichiometric PbO, TiO2, MnO2, YbNbO4, and MgNb2O6 precursors in ethanol with ZrO2 media.
Calcine the mixture at 775 °C for 2 hours followed by ball milling again.
Add 3 vol% BaTiO3 templates into the slurry.
Burn out binders and cold isostatic press green samples at 200 MPa.
Sinter textured ceramics between 1150 and 1200 °C for 6 hours.

reference_steps: High purity raw materials were weighed based on stoichiometric formula for BNT-6BT ceramics.
Weighed raw materials were ball-milled for 24 h in ethanol using zirconia balls with 3 mm diameter.
Dried powders were calcined at 900°C for 4 hours.
1 mol% B3+ was added to pre-synthesized undoped and 1 mol% Mn3+ doped BNT-6BT before second milling.
Screened powders (<90 µm) were mixed with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol as binder.
Mixture was uniaxially pressed at 100 MPa pressure to form disc samples with 12 mm diameter.
Pre-shaped specimens were re-pressed via cold isostatic press at 150 MPa.
PVA binder was burnt out at 600°C for 4 h with 1°C/min heating rate.
Final sintering process was performed at 1150°C for 12 h in air.
test_steps: Weigh the raw materials.
Ball-mill the raw materials for 24 hours in ethanol using zirconia balls.
Dry and calcine the powders at 900 °C for 4 hours.
Add 1 mol% BE3+ to both pre-synthesized undoped and 1 mol% MnE3+ doped BNT-6BT.
Uniaxially press the mixture at 100 MPa to form disc samples.
Re-press the pre-shaped specimens via cold isostatic press at 150 MPa.
Burn out the PVA binder at 600 °C for 4 hours.
Sinter the samples at 1150 °C for 12 hours in air.

reference_steps: Pure Mg substrate was mechanically ground with SiC paper up to 1000 grit and ultrasonically cleaned in ethyl alcohol.
Electrolyte was prepared with 20 g/L Na2SiO3 + 4 g/L KF + 2 g/L NaOH.
BaTiO3 powder (2 g/L or 5 g/L) was added to the electrolyte.
Mg plates were used as anode and stainless steel chamber as cathode during PEO process.
Pulse reverse power provided constant current of 2 A/dm2 for 660 s under frequency of 500 Hz and duty cycle of 15%.
Solution was cooled using water-cooling system at 30 ± 5°C during coating process.
After PEO treatment samples were rinsed in distilled water and dried in warm air.
test_steps: Select pure Mg as substrate material.
Mechanically grind samples with SiC paper up to 1000 grit.
Ultrasonically clean samples in ethyl alcohol.
Dry samples in cold air.
Prepare electrolyte with 20 g/L Na2SiO3, 4 g/L KF, and 2 g/L NaOH.
Add BaTiO3 powder to the electrolyte at concentrations of 2 g/L and 5 g/L.
Use Mg plates as anode and stainless steel chamber as cathode.
Apply pulse reverse power with a constant current of 2 A/dm² for 660 s at 500 Hz and 15% duty cycle.
Cool the solution using a water-cooling system at 30 ± 5 °C during the coating process.
Rinse samples in distilled water and dry in warm air.
Relax the geometry structure of pristine MoS2 unit cell.
Construct a 4x4 MoS2 supercell.
Adsorb transition metals (TM = Ni, Pd, Pt, Ir) on the MoS2 supercell.
Consider the influence of concentration by adsorbing TMs on 4x4, 3x3, and 2x2 supercells.
Analyze the structural parameters and bond lengths after adsorption.

reference_steps: NBT-0.6CeO2 powders (0.05-0.25 vol%) were dispersed in P(VDF-TrFE) matrix using 10 wt% DEC solvent.
Thin films were fabricated by spin-coating onto glass substrates pre-coated with aluminum electrodes.
Metal-insulator-metal structure was formed by depositing additional aluminum electrodes onto spin-coated films.
Samples were annealed at 100°C to optimize crystallinity.
For piezoelectric measurements, bulk samples were prepared by solution casting method with thickness of 30 μm.
Samples underwent DC poling at 65°C under electric field of 200 MV/m for 60 min in silicone oil bath.
Samples were slowly cooled to room temperature while maintaining electric field.
test_steps: Disperse NBT-0.6CeO2 in P(VDF-TrFE) matrix using DEC solvent.
Fabricate thin films by spin-coating onto glass substrates pre-coated with aluminum electrodes.
Form a metal-insulator-metal (MIM) structure by depositing additional aluminum electrodes onto the spin-coated films.
Anneal samples at 100°C to optimize crystallinity.
Prepare bulk samples for piezoelectric measurements using solution casting method.

reference_steps: 1.74 g PVDF was dissolved in 20 ml N,N-dimethylformamide at 60°C.
10-50 wt.% BCT3 filler was added to solution after four hours of PVDF mixing in DMF.
Solution was stirred at 500 rpm on hot plate for additional four hours to achieve homogeneous distribution.
Solution was cast in cleaned petri dish and annealed in oven at 100°C for 5 hours.
Films were peeled off from glass petri dish and cut into square pieces.
Films were hot pressed at 100°C by applying 125 kg/cm2 pressure for two hours.
Silver electrodes were painted on both sides of films and heated on hot plate for one hour.
Films were poled by applying DC electric field of 100 kV/cm for 1 hour before PE measurements.
test_steps: Dissolve 1.74 g of PVDF in 20 ml of N,N-dimethylformamide at 60 °C.
Add 10, 20, 30, 40, and 50 wt.% of BCT3 filler to the solution after four hours of mixing.
Stir the solution at 500 rpm on a hot plate for an additional four hours.
Cast the solution in a cleaned petri dish and anneal in an oven at 100 °C for 5 hours.
Peel off the obtained films from the glass petri dish and cut into square pieces.
Hot press the films at 100 °C with a pressure of 125 kg/cm².

reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to chemical formula and adequately ball-milled for 24 h.
Powder was pre-fired in muffle furnace at 780°C for 4h at heating rate of 2°C/min.
8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol was added as binder and powder was pressed into 8 mm diameter disks at uniaxial pressure of 12 MPa.
Disks were sintered at ramp rate of 2°C/min for 3 h at 600°C to remove PVA.
Final sintering was conducted at 1000°C for 6 h to obtain ceramic wafers.
Ceramic discs with double-sided silver electrodes were polarized in silicon oil at 120°C under DC field of 5 kV/cm for 20 min.
test_steps: Weigh raw materials according to the chemical formula.
Ball-mill the powder for 24 hours.
Pre-fire the powder in a muffle furnace at 780 °C for 4 hours at a heating rate of 2 °C/min.
Add 8 wt% of polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as a binder.
Press a small amount of the powder into 8 mm diameter disks at a uniaxial pressure of 12 MPa.
Sinter the disks at a ramp rate of 2 °C/min for 3 hours at 600 °C to remove the PVA.
Sinter the disks at 1000 °C for 6 hours to obtain ceramic wafers.
Polarize the ceramic discs with double-sided silver electrodes by placing them in silicon oil at 120 °C and holding them at a DC field of 5 kV/cm for 20 minutes.

reference_steps: Raw materials were weighed according to chemical formula and mixed using conventional solid-state reaction method.
Powders were calcined at 900°C.
Materials were sintered at 1150°C to obtain ceramic samples.
Samples were prepared for electrical measurements by applying silver electrodes.
Ceramics were poled for piezoelectric measurements.
Raw materials were ball milled with ethyl alcohol for 12 h at 300 r/min after weighing according to stoichiometry ratio.
Powders were dried in oven and calcined at 890°C for 6 h.
Powders were ball-milled again for 12 h.
Powder mixtures were dried, sieved, and pressed into pellets with diameter of 10 mm at 200 MPa using cold isostatic press.
Pellets were sintered in ambient air using two-step sintering technology.
Temperature was raised to 1190°C with heating rate of 10°C/min, then rapidly cooled to 1090°C and dwelled for 3-15 h.
Samples were placed in sealed crucible and covered with self-sourced powders to minimize volatilization losses.
Two sides of as-sintered samples were printed with silver paste and baked at 600°C for 30 min to form electrodes.
Samples were poled at 5 kV/cm for 30 min before piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Ball milled precursors with ethyl alcohol for 12 h at 300 r/min.
Dried the powders in an oven.
Calcined the powders at 890 °C for 6 h.
Ball-milled the powders again for 12 h.
Dried and sieved the powder mixtures.
Pressed into pellets with a diameter of 10 mm at 200 MPa using a cold isostatic press.
Raised the temperature to 1190 °C with a heating rate of 10 °C/min.
Rapidly cooled down to 1090 °C and dwelled for 3-15 h before naturally cooling down.

reference_steps: Raw materials were mixed and calcined at 700-875°C for 5 h.
Calcined powders were re-milled for 24 h at 250 rpm using planetary ball mill with ethanol and yttrium stabilized zirconia balls.
Calcined powders were filled into cylindric Molybdenum die covered with graphite foil.
Water (5 wt%) was added dropwise before upper punch insertion.
Force of 45 kN (400 MPa pressure) was applied for 40 min with gradual temperature increase of 5°C/min reaching 200°C.
Thermal post-treatment at 850°C for 25 min with lower pressure of 245 MPa and heating/cooling rate of 10°C/min in vacuum.
Samples were re-oxidized for 6 h at 850°C in oxygen to equilibrate point defects.
Both sides of polished pellets were coated with platinum via sputtering for electrical measurements.
DC poling at 2.5 kV/mm for 30 min at 120°C for piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Mix the powders
Calcine at temperatures ranging from 700 to 875 °C for 5 h
Re-mill for 24 h at 250 rpm using a planetary ball mill with ethanol and yttrium stabilized zirconia balls
Perform cold sintering-assisted experiments using an SPS machine in vacuum
Apply a force of 45 kN (400 MPa) while gradually increasing temperature to 200 °C
Conduct thermal post-treatment at 850 °C for 25 min with a pressure of 245 MPa
Re-oxidize samples for 6 h at 850 °C in oxygen

reference_steps: Raw powders were weighed according to proportion of corresponding components.
Weighed materials and ethanol were poured into jar and ball milled for 24 h with ZrO2 balls.
Ball-milled powders were dried and calcined at 850°C for 6 h.
Raw powders were mixed according to proportion and ball milled for 24 h with ZrO2 balls again.
Dried mixed powders were granulated into floc with 8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol as binder.
Powders were pressed into disks (1 mm thickness, 10 mm diameter) under pressure of 10 MPa.
After removing PVA, disks were buried in calcined powders and sintered at 1150°C for 3 h in air.
Heating rate was 5°C/min from RT to 1000°C, then 3°C/min beyond 1000°C.
Both sides of sintered samples were mechanically polished and brushed with silver layer.
Samples with silver electrodes were processed at 600°C for 10 min.
Poling process was carried out in silicone oil at room temperature under electric fields of 5 kV/mm for 3 min.
test_steps: Weigh the raw materials and mix with ethanol.
Ball mill the mixture for 24 hours with ZrO2 balls.
Calcine the dried powders at 850 °C for 6 hours.
Mix the calcined powders according to the proportion of components and add ethanol.
Ball mill the mixed powders for another 24 hours with ZrO2 balls.
Granulate the dried mixed powders with 8 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as a binder.
Press the granulated powders into disks under a pressure of 10 MPa.
Remove PVA and sinter the disks at 1150 °C for 3 hours in an air atmosphere.
Process the samples with silver electrodes at 600 °C for 10 minutes.

reference_steps: High-purity oxides were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio.
Powders were ball-milled in ethanol medium with zirconia balls for 24 h.
After drying in oven, mixture was calcined at 850°C for 3 h.
Calcined powder underwent additional 12 h ball milling process in ethanol.
Powders were dried and granulated by adding 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol.
Mixture was sieved through 80-mesh screen to obtain uniform powder particles.
Samples were crafted by uniaxially dry pressing powder mixtures with diameter of 10 mm and thickness of 1.5 mm.
Binder was removed at 550°C.
Samples underwent sintering at rate of 3°C/min, reaching temperatures between 1120-1200°C for 2 h in ambient air.
Green discs were coated with identical powder to prevent evaporation of Pb and Bi.
Ag electrodes were applied on both surfaces and fired at 600°C for 15 min.
Ceramics were poled under electric field of 4 kV/mm at 120°C for 20 min in silicon oil.
test_steps: Weigh the high-purity oxides according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Ball-mill the powders in an ethanol medium with zirconia balls for 24 h.
Dry the mixture in the oven.
Calcine the mixture at 850 °C for 3 h.
Ball mill the calcined powder in ethanol for an additional 12 h.
Dry and granulate the mixture by adding 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol.
Sieve the mixture through an 80-mesh screen to obtain uniform powder particles.
Uniaxially dry press the powder mixtures into samples with a diameter of 10 mm and a thickness of 1.5 mm.
Sinter the samples at a rate of 3 °C/min, reaching temperatures between 1120 and 1200 °C for 2 h in ambient air after removing the binder at 550 °C.

reference_steps: Water-soluble metal salts were used as starting materials for hydro-evaporation synthesis.
After evaporation at 80°C, formed precursor precipitates were additionally heated at same temperature for 30 min to dry completely.
Dry precursor precipitates were ground in agate mortar to obtain precursor powders.
Precursor powders were calcined at 650°C for 3 h in air.
Ceramic powders were pressed uniaxially at 880 MPa in 6 mm die.
Samples were sintered at various temperatures (780°C or 835°C) for 3 h in air to achieve optimal compositions and microstructures.
Ceramic samples were sliced to 200 µm thickness for electrical measurements.
Samples were electrically poled at different electric fields during 1 s soaking time at room temperature.
test_steps: Synthesize powders by hydro-evaporation method starting from water-soluble metal salts.
Evaporate at 80 °C and heat formed precursor precipitates at the same temperature for 30 min to dry completely.
Perform differential scanning calorimetry (DSC) and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) from 30 °C to 800 °C in air with a heating rate of 20 °C/min.
Calcine precursor powders at 650 °C for 3 h in air.
Press as-obtained ceramic powders uniaxially at 880 MPa in a 6 mm die.
Sinter the pressed powders at various temperatures to achieve optimal compositions and microstructures.

reference_steps: 99.9% pure chemicals were weighed and mixed in stoichiometric ratio according to formula.
Lead loss during heat treatment was balanced with 6 wt% PbO in each composition.
Sintered powder was made fine in agate mortar.
Methanol was added as dispersing agent and left for 1 h to ensure uniform mixing.
PVA (5 wt%) was added as binder with PVA-to-ceramic powder weight ratio of 1:20.
Powder was pressed into pellets using uniaxial hydraulic press at 150 MPa pressure for 3 min.
Calcination was repeated twice to achieve homogeneous and single-phase composition.
Sintering was carried out in air atmosphere at 1150°C for 4 h.
Flat surfaces of pellets were coated with gold and silver paint electrodes applied and heated at 600°C for 30 min.
Samples were poled using Belding & McLaren method by heating to 100-110°C in silicon oil and applying DC electric field of 20-30 kV/cm.
test_steps: Weigh and mix raw powdered materials in stoichiometric ratio.
Add methanol as a dispersing agent and mix for 1 hour.
Add PVA as a binder with a PVA-to-ceramic powder weight ratio of 1:20.
Press the powder into pellets using a uniaxial hydraulic press at 150 MPa for 3 minutes.
Sinter the pellets in air at 1150 °C for 4 hours.

reference_steps: Analytical reagents were mixed in stoichiometric ratios by ball milling with alcohol as solvent for 12 h.
Prepared powders were dried and calcined at 900°C.
Calcined powders were milled and dried again.
Powders were pressed into pellets using polyvinyl alcohol as binder.
Pellets were fired at 600°C to remove binder.
Samples were subsequently sintered at 1070°C-1170°C for 6 h under ambient atmosphere.
Sintered ceramic specimens were polished and coated with silver electrodes on top and bottom surfaces.
Optimal sintered specimen with highest d33 was selected through experimental trials by adjusting sintering temperature.
Ceramic specimens were poled in silicone oil at 4 kV/mm for piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Mix the materials in stoichiometric ratios by ball milling with alcohol as a solvent for 12 h.
Dry and calcine the prepared powders at 900 °C.
Fire the pellets at 600 °C to remove the binder.
Sinter the pellets at 1070 °C-1170 °C for 6 h under an ambient atmosphere.
Select the optimal sintered specimen with the highest d33.

method.reference: template grain growth (TGG) with solid-state reaction

reference_steps: High purity precursors were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and mixed by ball-milling in anhydrous ethanol for 24 h.
Mixed powders were calcined at 850°C for 5 h to form main perovskite structure.
Slurry was prepared by mixing KNNS-(0.04-x)CZ-xBAZ matrix and NaNbO3 templates in ethanol/toluene co-solvent with PVB binder and MnO2 sintering aid.
Uniform slurry was tape casted to green tapes using doctor blade with thickness of 30-50 μm.
Green tapes were cut, stacked, and uniaxially pressed under 15 MPa at 70°C for 20 min.
Organic binder was removed at 600°C.
Samples were heated to 1190°C, then rapidly cooled to 1090°C and dwelled for 10 h.
Final textured ceramics were obtained after controlled cooling.
test_steps: Prepare KNNS-(0.04-x)CZ-xBAZ powders by high temperature solid state reaction method.
Weigh precursors according to stoichiometric ratio.
Mix precursors by ball-milling in anhydrous ethanol for 24 h.
Calcine the mixture at 850 °C for 5 h to form main perovskite structure.
Prepare slurry by mixing KNNS-(0.04-x)CZ-xBAZ matrix and NaNbO3 templates in ethanol/toluene co-solvent with PVB binder and MnO2 sintering aid.
Tape cast the uniform slurry to green tapes using a doctor blade with a thickness of 30-50 µm.
Dry the green tapes, cut, stack, and uniaxially press under a pressure of 15 MPa at 70 °C for 20 min.
Remove organic binder at 600 °C.
Heat samples to 1190 °C, rapidly cool to 1090 °C, and dwell for 10 h.

reference_steps: High-purity raw materials were weighed according to stoichiometry ratio of 0.957K0.48Na0.52Nb0.96Sb0.04O3-0.04Bi0.5Na0.5ZrO3-0.003CaZrO3.
Materials were ball milled with ethyl alcohol for 12 h at 300 rpm.
After drying, powders were divided into 4 batches and calcined at 800, 850, 900, and 950°C respectively.
Part of powders were pressed into compacts with diameter of 10 mm at 200 MPa using cold isostatic press.
Residual powders were subjected to another ball-milling for 24 h and pressed into pellets under same conditions.
All pellets were sintered using two-step sintering technique - rapidly raised to 1190°C at 10°C/min heating rate.
Temperature was rapidly cooled down to 1090°C and dwelled for 5 h before natural cooling.
For electrical measurements, samples were printed with silver paste and baked at 600°C for 30 min to form electrodes.
Samples were poled at 5 kV/cm for 30 min and aged for 20 h before testing.
test_steps: Weigh high-purity raw materials according to stoichiometry ratio.
Ball mill the mixture with ethyl alcohol for 12 h at 300 rpm.
Dry the powders and divide into 4 batches.
Calcine the batches at 800, 850, 900, and 950 °C.
Press a part of the powders into compacts at 200 MPa using cold isostatic press (group A).
Ball mill the residual powders for another 24 h (group B) and press into pellets.
Sinter all pellets using two-step sintering technique, rapidly raise temperature to 1190 °C, cool to 1090 °C, and dwell for 5 h before natural cooling.

reference_steps: Starting materials were mixed in stoichiometric ratios for Ba1-xSrxTi0.92Zr0.08O3 formula with x = 0, 0.04, 0.08, 0.12, 0.16, 0.2 mol.
Materials were subjected to ball milling in ethanol at 400 rpm for 12 h.
Mixture underwent drying and then fired at 1200°C for duration of 2 h.
After calcination, material was thoroughly blended with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
Mixture was compacted into discs measuring 15 mm across and 1 mm thickness by applying pressure of 10 MPa.
Molded ceramics were placed in muffle furnace, ramped to 650°C at rate of 5°C/min and held for 2 h to eliminate PVA.
Samples were heated to 1400°C at 5°C/min and sintered in air for 3 h.
For electrical characterization, ceramic surfaces were uniformly coated with silver paste on both sides.
Silver paste was cured by heating at 600°C for 30 min.
Ceramics were immersed in silicone oil bath at 40°C and subjected to polarization with DC field of 30 kV/cm for 20 min.
test_steps: Mix starting materials in stoichiometric ratios.
Ball mill the mixture in ethanol at 400 rpm for 12 h.
Dry the mixture.
Fire the mixture at 1200 °C for 2 h.
Blend the material with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
Compact the blended material into discs measuring 15 mm in diameter and 1 mm in thickness at a pressure of 10 MPa.
Place the molded ceramics in a muffle furnace, ramp to 650 °C at 5 °C/min, and hold for 2 h to eliminate PVA.
Heat to 1400 °C at 5 °C/min and sinter in air for 3 h.

reference_steps: Raw materials were prepared for 0.725BiFe(1-x)ScxO3-0.275BaTiO3 ceramics with x = 0, 0.0025, 0.0050, 0.0075, 0.010, 0.015, 0.02.
Carbonates were dried in oven at 120°C for more than 2 h before use.
Raw materials were mixed by ball-milling machine in ethanol.
After drying, powder mixture was calcined twice at 800°C for 2 h.
Calcined powders were milled for 12 h and then pressed into disks with 12.7 mm diameter using polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) as binder.
Green compacts were first fired at 600°C to remove PVA binder.
Samples were sintered in ambient atmosphere at temperature range of 1000°C-1020°C for 2 h.
Sintered disks were subjected to mechanical polishing to obtain thickness of ~0.35 mm.
Gold electrodes were sputtered onto ceramic surfaces for electrical measurements.
Ceramics were polarized at 120°C in silicone oil bath under DC electric field ranging from 5 to 6 kV/mm for 15-20 min.
test_steps: Dry carbonates in an oven at 120 °C for more than 2 h.
Mix raw materials using a ball-milling machine in ethanol.
Dry the powder mixture.
Calcine the powder mixture twice at 800 °C for 2 h.
Mill the calcined powders for 12 h.
Press the milled powders into disks with 12.7 mm diameter using PVA as a binder.
Fire the green compacts at 600 °C to remove the PVA binder.
Sinter the disks in ambient atmosphere at a temperature in the range of 1000 °C–1020 °C for 2 h.
Subject the sintered disks to mechanical polishing to obtain a thickness of approximately 0.35 mm.

reference_steps: 0.74 Pb(Mg1/3Nb2/3)O3-0.26PbTiO3 (PMN-0.26 PT) single crystals were grown by modified Bridgman method.
As-grown single crystals were oriented by rotating XRD method.
[001]-oriented square slices were cut with size 4 × 4 × 0.8 mm³.
Layer of Ni was covered on (001) plane crystal slices to enhance binding force between single crystal and electrode.
Au electrode was sputtered on crystal slices for poling and electrical performance measurement.
All samples were annealed at 600°C for 10 h and then air-cooled to room temperature.
Samples were placed at room temperature for 2 days to completely release internal stress.
For electrical measurements, samples were poled using direct current poling (DCP) or alternating current poling (ACP) procedures.
During poling processes, single crystals were immersed in silicon oil to avoid arcing breakdown.
Electrical performance was measured 24 h after poling considering aging effect of materials.
test_steps: Grow single crystals using the modified Bridgeman method.
Orient the as-grown single crystals by the rotating XRD method.
Cut the [001]-oriented square slices with size 4 × 4 × 0.8 mm.
Cover the (001) plane crystal slices with a layer of Ni.
Sputter Au electrode on the crystal slices for poling.
Anneal all samples at 600 °C for 10 h and air-cool to room temperature.
Place samples at room temperature for 2 days to release internal stress.

reference_steps: AlN thin films were deposited by DC reactive magnetron sputtering from 100 × 300 mm² Al target (99.99% purity) using N2 and Ar as process gases.
Layers were deposited on 0.80-inch single side polished (100)-oriented Si substrates.
Substrates were cleaned in ultrasonic cleaning system: 5 minutes in Decon neutracon solvent, 5 minutes in WashBryte solvent, 5 minutes in deionized water.
Substrates were dried under N2 flow and loaded into deposition system under residual pressure around 10⁻⁷ mbar.
Al target was cleaned in pure Ar (flow of 30 sccm) at 300 W for 10 min to remove oxygen contamination.
Target was conditioned for 5 min in reactive atmosphere (Ar/N2 plasma) to reach stable reactive conditions.
AlN thin films were deposited using magnetron powers of 70-400 W and Ar & N2 flows of 20-40 sccm.
All experiments were conducted at room temperature with deposition time set at two hours.
Samples were characterized for thickness, morphology, crystallinity, and piezoelectric properties after deposition.
test_steps: Clean substrates in an ultrasonic cleaning system consisting of Decon neutracon solvent, WashBryte solvent, and deionized water.
Dry substrates under N2 flow and load into the deposition system under a residual pressure around 10E^{-7} mbar.
Clean the Al target in pure Ar at 300 W for 10 min followed by 5 min in a reactive atmosphere (Ar/N2 plasma).
Deposit AlN thin films using magnetron powers of 70 and 400 W, and Ar & N2 flows of 20 and 40 sccm.

reference_steps: Co(NO3)2·6H2O (2 mmol), urea (10 mmol), and ammonium fluoride (4 mmol) were dissolved in 60 mL of deionized water.
The mixture was stirred for 30 minutes to form a homogeneous solution.
The resulting solution was transferred into a 100 mL Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave.
The autoclave was heated to 120 °C and maintained for 12 hours.
After cooling to room temperature, the precipitate was collected by centrifugation.
The product was washed with deionized water and ethanol several times.
The final product was dried at 60 °C for 6 hours.
test_steps: Dissolving 2 mmol of Co(NO3)2·6H2O, 10 mmol of urea, and 4 mmol of NH4F in 60 ml of deionized water.
Stirring the mixture for 30 min to form a pink transparent solution.
Transferring the resulting solution to a 100 ml Teflon-lined stainless-steel autoclave.
Heating the autoclave to 120°C for 12 h.
Collecting the precipitate by centrifugation after the autoclave cooled to room temperature.
Washing the collected precipitate with deionized water and absolute ethanol.
Drying the final product at 60°C for 6 h in an oven.

reference_steps: Barium acetate, calcium acetate and tin acetate were added in 2-ethylhexanoic acid in stoichiometric ratio and dissolved by heating at 80°C until clear solution was obtained.
Desired stoichiometric quantity of C16H36O4Ti was mixed in the same solvent in separate beaker and then added to the previous solution.
Final solution was stirred and mixed for 1 h under continuous heating at 80°C.
Solution was dried to obtain BCST powder.
BCST powder was calcined at 1000°C for 4 h in muffle furnace.
Calcined powder was grinded in mortar pestle with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol solution until fine powder was obtained.
Pellets were prepared by compressing under 5 ton pressure.
Pellets were sintered at 1100°C and 1200°C for 5 h to get densified BCST ceramics samples.
test_steps: Barium acetate, calcium acetate and tin acetate were added in 2-ethylhexanoic acid in stoichiometric ratio and dissolved by heating the mixture at 80 °C until clear solution was obtained.
The desired stoichiometric quantity of C16H36O4Ti was mixed in the same solvent in a separate beaker and then added to the previous solution.
The final solution was stirred and mixed for 1 h under continuous heating at temperature 80 °C.
The solution was dried to obtain BCST powder.
The BCST powder was calcined at temperature 1000 °C for 4 h in a muffle furnace.
The calcined powder was ground in a mortar pestle with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) solution until fine powder was obtained.
Pellets of the ground powder were prepared by compressing under 5 ton pressure.
The pellets were sintered at two different temperatures 1100 and 1200 °C for 5 h.

reference_steps: Raw materials were accurately weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and subjected to milling in alcohol with zirconia balls for 12 hours.
Materials were dried and presintered at 750°C for 2 hours.
Calcined powder underwent additional ball-milling process lasting 24 hours.
Powders were mixed with 7 wt% polyvinyl alcohol and compressed into gray disks measuring 13 mm in diameter.
Prepared disks were sintered at temperatures ranging from 1180 to 1270°C in air for 3 hours.
Samples were polished and coated with silver as electrodes to facilitate electrical characterization.
test_steps: Accurately weigh raw materials according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Milling in alcohol with zirconia balls for 12 hours.
Dry and presinter at 750 °C for 2 hours.
Calcined powder undergoes additional ball-milling for 24 hours.
Mix powders with 7 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA).
Compress into gray disks measuring 13 mm in diameter.
Sinter disks at temperatures ranging from 1180 to 1270 °C in air for 3 hours.

reference_steps: Raw materials were precisely weighed on the basis of stoichiometric ratio and mixed in deionized water.
Materials were grounded for 6 h by ball-milling with ratio of materials to balls to water as 1:2:1.
Powder was pressed into blocks and calcined at 850°C for 2 hours.
Calcined powder was ball-milled for 12 hours again to obtain uniform PMS-PZT powder.
Dried powder combined with PVA binder was pressed into pellets of diameter 20 mm and thickness 1.4 mm at pressure of 7 MPa.
Green bodies were heated at 550°C for 3 h to remove the PVA.
Green bodies were sintered at 1250°C for 2 h in sealed alumina crucible with same composition powder on surface to minimize PbO evaporation.
Sintered ceramics were ground into thickness of 1 mm.
Silver electrodes were fired on top and bottom surfaces at 720°C for 20 min.
Ceramics were poled in silicon oil at 130°C for 40 minutes under DC electric field of 35 kV/mm.
Polarized ceramics were aged for at least 24 hours at room temperature before testing.
test_steps: Weigh the raw materials based on stoichiometric ratio.
Mix materials in deionized water and grind for 6 hours by ball-milling.
Press the powder into blocks and calcine at 850 °C for 2 hours.
Ball-mill the calcined powder for 12 hours to obtain uniform PMS-PZT powder.
Combine dried powder with binders PVA and press into pellets at 7 MPa.
Heat the green bodies at 550 °C for 3 hours to remove PVA.
Sinter the green bodies at 1250 °C for 2 hours in a sealed alumina crucible.
Grind the sintered ceramics to a thickness of 1 mm.
Fire silver electrodes on the top and bottom surfaces at 720 °C for 20 minutes.
Pole the ceramics in silicon oil at 130 °C for 40 minutes under a DC electric field of 35 kV/mm.
Age the polarized ceramics for at least 24 hours at room temperature.

reference_steps: Raw powders were weighed according to stoichiometric formulae and ball milled for 24 h in polypropylene containers with ethanol and ZrO2 balls using planetary milling machine.
After drying the mixture, first calcination process was carried out at 850°C for 2 h to prevent volatilization of Bi3+.
Second calcination cycle was conducted at 900°C for 4 h.
Calcined powder was re-milled for 24 h and thermally treated in additional two-stage calcination process at 950°C for 4 h, followed by calcination at 1000°C for 2 h.
Obtained powder was milled again for 4 h to homogeneously reduce particle size.
Powder was mixed with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol binder in mortar and uniaxial cold-pressed into pellets with diameter of 12 mm.
Pellets were covered with powder of same composition and sintered at 1100°C for 2 h in sealed alumina crucibles.
Calcination and sintering processes were performed at heating rate of 5°C/min.
Drying procedures were carried out at 120°C on hot plate for 12 h.
test_steps: Weigh the raw powders according to the stoichiometric formulae.
Ball mill the powders for 24 h in polypropylene containers with ethanol and ZrO2 balls.
Perform the first calcination at 850°C for 2 h.
Conduct the second calcination at 900°C for 4 h.
Re-mill the calcined powder for 24 h.
Thermally treat the powder in a two-stage calcination process at 950°C for 4 h.
Perform calcination at 1000°C for 2 h.
Milling the obtained powder for 4 h to reduce particle size.
Mix the powder with a binder (5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol) in a mortar.
Uniaxially cold-press the mixture into pellets with a diameter of 12 mm.
Cover the pellets with powder of the same composition.
Sinter the pellets at 1100°C for 2 h in sealed alumina crucibles.
Carry out drying procedures at 120°C on a hot plate for 12 h.

reference_steps: Weighed chemicals were wet-milled in polyethylene bottles with ZrO2 balls for 12 h in ethanol.
Materials were calcined at 750°C for 3 hours.
Calcined powders were milled, dried, ground, and granulated with polyvinyl alcohol binder.
Granulated powders were pressed into discs with diameters of 12.5 mm and thicknesses of 1.0 mm at pressure of 150 MPa.
Pellets were heated to 650°C for 60 min to burn out the binder.
Samples were sintered at 1080°C for 3 h.
Sintered samples were polished to thickness of approximately 0.5 mm.
Silver paste was screen-printed onto two parallel polished surfaces, followed by firing at 570°C for 30 min.
test_steps: Weighed chemicals were wet-milled in polyethylene bottles with ZrO2 balls for 12 h in ethanol.
Calcination at 750 °C for 3 hours.
Milled, dried, ground, and granulated with a polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
Pressed into discs with diameters of 12.5 mm and thicknesses of 1.0 mm at a pressure of 150 MPa.
Heated to 650 °C for 60 min to burn out the binder.
Sintered at 1080 °C for 3 h.
Polished to a thickness of approximately 0.5 mm.
Screen-printed silver paste onto the two parallel polished surfaces.
Fired at 570 °C for 30 min.

reference_steps: Precursors were dried for minimum of 12 hours in 120°C drying oven prior to planetary ball milling.
Ball milling was conducted in 100% ethanol with 250 mL ZrO2 milling jar and 5 mm ZrO2 media for 3 h at 125 rpm.
Resulting slurry was dried using rotary evaporator, ground with agate mortar and pestle, and sieved with 250 µm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Three individual calcination pellets with nominal weight of 3.0 g and diameter of 25 mm were uniaxially pressed under 5 MPa.
Calcination pellets were calcined in partially closed alumina crucible at 801.5°C for 4 hours with heating rate of 3°C/min and cooling rate of approximately 4°C/min.
Following calcination, pellets were milled in 100% ethanol with 250 mL ZrO2 milling jar and 5 mm ZrO2 media for 30 minutes at 125 rpm.
Resulting slurry was dried using rotary evaporator, ground with agate mortar and pestle, and sieved with 150 µm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Approximately 24 sintering pellets with nominal weight of 0.30 g and diameter of 10 mm were uniaxially pressed under 30 MPa.
Pellets were isostatically pressed under 200 MPa with dwell time of one minute.
Pellets were sintered in batches of 3 in partially closed alumina crucible at 1103.5°C for 2 hours with heating rate of 5°C/min and cooling rate of approximately 4°C/min.
test_steps: Dry precursors in a 120 °C drying oven for a minimum of 12 hours.
Conduct planetary ball milling in 100 % ethanol for 3 hours at 125 rpm.
Dry the resulting slurry using a rotary evaporator.
Grind the dried slurry with an agate mortar and pestle.
Sieve the ground material with a 250 µm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Uniaxially press three individual calcination pellets under 5 MPa.
Calcine pellets in a muffle furnace at 801.5 °C for 4 hours with a heating rate of 3 °C/min.
Mill the calcined pellets in 100 % ethanol for 30 minutes at 125 rpm.
Dry the resulting slurry using a rotary evaporator.
Grind and sieve the material with a 150 µm mesh stainless steel sieve.
Uniaxially press approximately 24 sintering pellets under 30 MPa.
Isostatically press pellets under 200 MPa with a dwell time of one minute.
Sinter pellets in a muffle furnace at 1103.5 °C for 2 hours with a heating rate of 5 °C/min.
Prepare sintered pellets to a 1 µm surface finish prior to SEM/EDX analysis.

reference_steps: Powders were precisely weighed according to stoichiometric ratios and transferred to nylon tube for 12 h of ball milling in alcohol dispersing medium.
Mixed slurry was dried and calcined at 850°C for 4 h.
Calcined powder was subsequently milled again for 12 h.
0.3 g of ceramic powder was pressed into disc with diameter of 8 mm and thickness of 1.3 mm under pressure of 250 MPa.
Surface of green bodies was covered with ceramic powder of same composition and sintered in air at 1100°C for 4 h to obtain dense ceramic sheets.
Samples were polished to required thickness and platinum electrodes were applied and cured on both sides.
Samples were polarized in silicone oil bath at 180°C under electric field of 160-200 kV/cm for 30 min.
test_steps: Weigh powders according to stoichiometric ratios.
Transfer to a nylon tube for 12 h of ball milling in an alcohol dispersing medium.
Dry the mixed slurry.
Calcine at 850 °C for 4 h.
Mill again for 12 h.
Press 0.3 g of ceramic powder into a disc with a diameter of 8 mm and a thickness of 1.3 mm under a pressure of 250 MPa.
Cover the surface of green bodies with ceramic powder of the same composition.
Sinter in air at 1100 °C for 4 h.

reference_steps: Nonwoven ES fiber mats of P(VDF-TrFE) 80/20 were prepared from 12 wt% methyl ether ketone solution using electrospinning equipped with grounded rolling collector.

First thermal annealing (1A) process was performed by holding ES fiber mat isothermally at 140°C for various times (10, 60, 180, 360, 720, 1440, and 2880 min) to produce ECCs via chain-sliding motions in paraelectric phase.
Second annealing (2A) was carried out for ES1A-2880 min below TC with fixed isothermal time of 1 day at temperatures of 110, 115, 125, and 130°C to further increase ferroelectric domain size.
Corona-charging was employed to achieve permanent remanent polarization for piezoelectricity.
For corona-poling in water, methanol was used to wet fiber mats first and then replaced with water.
AC corona poling at 500 kHz was performed in water to avoid formation of ionic EDLs and potential electrolytic degradation.
After corona-poling in water, samples were dried in vacuum before characterization.
test_steps: Prepare nonwoven ES fiber mats from 12 wt% MEK solution using electrospinning.
Perform multi-step thermal annealing processes to achieve ECCs with thickened ferroelectric domains.
Conduct first thermal annealing (1A) at 140 °C isothermally for various times (10, 60, 180, 360, 720, 1440, and 2880 min).
Monitor the effect of thermal annealing time on TC and Tm using differential scanning calorimetry (DSC).
Conduct second thermal annealing (2A) below TC with fixed isothermal time of 1 day at temperatures of 110, 115, 125, and 130 °C.
Perform corona-charging to achieve permanent remanent polarization (Pr0) for piezoelectricity.
Combine damping back cover, piezoelectric ceramic stack, flange plate, amplifying front cover, fixture rod, and tool rod using high-strength bolts.
Design the piezoelectric stack consisting of several piezoelectric rings adopting the k33 vibration mode.
Limit the temperature of thermo-mechanical coupling load to 25-95°C and force to 0-40 N.
Measure the main parameters of PZT-8 piezoelectric ceramic using impedance analyzer and LCR meter.

method.reference: mixed oxide method with composite fabrication

reference_steps: BZT powder was prepared by calcining barium carbonate, zirconium dioxide and titanium dioxide at 1200°C for 2 h using mixed oxide method.
BZT powder was pressed into disc shape of ~15 mm diameter and thickness of ~1.5 mm at applied pressure of ~85 MPa.
BZT discs were sintered at 1450°C for 2 h.
BZT discs (dimension ~12 mm and thickness ~1.5 mm) were poled using electric field of 1.5 kV/mm at 50°C for 30 min in silicone oil chamber.
Poled BZT ceramic was cut using diamond saw in parallel direction along polarization axis using cut and fill method.
Mixtures of Portland cement powder, water (w/c ratio 0.35), epoxy resin and hardener (volume ratio 7.5) were prepared as matrix phase.
Mixture was filled into cut areas of BZT ceramic to create 1-3 connectivity composites with 40, 50, and 60 vol% BZT and 0, 3, 5, and 7 vol% epoxy resin.
Samples were cured in controlled chamber at 60°C for 5 days at 98% RH.
test_steps: Calcining barium carbonate, zirconium dioxide, and titanium dioxide at 1200 °C for 2 h to prepare BZT powder.
Pressing BZT powder into a disc shape of approximately 15 mm diameter and 1.5 mm thickness under a pressure of approximately 85 MPa.
Sintering BZT discs at 1450 °C for 2 h.
Poling BZT discs using an electric field of 1.5 kV/mm at 50 °C for 30 min in a silicone oil chamber.
Cutting poled BZT ceramic using a diamond saw in a parallel direction along with the polarization axis.
Filling the cut areas of the BZT ceramic with a mixture of Portland cement powder, water, epoxy resin, and hardener.
Curing the samples in a controlled chamber at 60 °C for 5 days at 98 %RH.

reference_steps: Sc2O3 and Nb2O5 powders were wet-mixed via ball milling for 12 h, followed by calcination at 1050°C for 6 h to obtain precursor ScNbO4.
Precursors were mixed with PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, MnO2, and Sb2O3 before being calcined at 850°C for 2 h to achieve desired composition of PZT-PMS-PSN.
Resultant powder was crushed for 8 h and then dried.
Fine powder was mixed with PVA binder at mass concentration of 7% and pressed to form Φ10mm pellets at pressure of 150 MPa.
After binder was cremated at 800°C for 2 h, PZT-PMS-PSN samples were sintered at 1180°C for 2 h.
Sintered pellets were polished to reach about 0.5 mm thickness.
Both sides of sample were coated with silver paste and fired at 800°C for 10 min for electrical property measurements.
Samples were polarized for 30 min at 180°C in silicone oil bath at DC field strength of 5 kV/mm for piezoelectric measurements.
test_steps: Wet-mix Sc2O3 and Nb2O5 powders via ball milling for 12 h.
Calcine the mixture at 1050 °C for 6 h to obtain ScNbO4 precursor.
Mix the ScNbO4 precursor with PbO, ZrO2, TiO2, MnO2, and Sb2O3.
Calcine the mixture at 850 °C for 2 h to achieve the desired composition.
Crush the resultant powder for 8 h and dry.
Mix the fine powder with PVA binder at a mass concentration of 7%.
Press to form 10 mm pellets at a pressure of 150 MPa.
Cremate the binder at 800 °C for 2 h.
Sinter the PZT-PMS-PSN samples at 1180 °C for 2 h.
Polish the sintered pellets to reach about 0.5 mm.

reference_steps: Dissolve Cobalt(II) nitrate hexahydrate and Terephthalic acid in a mixed solvent of N,N-dimethylformamide and ethanol
Transfer the solution to a Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave
Heat the autoclave at 120 °C for 24 hours
Cool the autoclave to room temperature naturally
Collect the product by centrifugation
Wash the product with N,N-dimethylformamide and ethanol
Dry the product in a vacuum oven at 60 °C overnight
test_steps: Cobalt nitrate hexahydrate and terephthalic acid were dissolved in a solvent mixture of DMF and ethanol.
The mixture was sealed in a Teflon-lined autoclave.
The autoclave was heated at 120 °C for a day.
The product was collected and washed with DMF and ethanol.
The product was dried under vacuum.
The powder was compacted into a bulk of dimensions of 15 mm × 2 mm × 2 mm.
The specimens were poled along the thickness direction.

reference_steps: Raw ingredients were weighed according to stoichiometric ratio and wet milled for 24 hours in ethanol medium using polyethylene bottles containing yttria-stabilized zirconia balls.
Milled precursors were dried in oven at 80°C overnight.
Dried powder was calcined at 1200°C for 4 hours in zirconia crucible.
Calcined powder was thoroughly ground in agate mortar to minimize particles and preserve appropriate homogeneity.
Combined powders were pelletized into disc-shaped samples using 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol binder.
Sintering was carried out for 4 hours at 1450°C at heating rate of 2°C per minute.
Sintered pellets were polished on silicon carbide paper.
Pellets were coated with silver paint on both sides and dried for 30 minutes at 600°C to facilitate electrical measurement.
test_steps: Weigh each powder using stoichiometric ratio.
Wet mill the mixture for 24 hours in ethanol medium using polyethylene bottles containing zirconia balls stabilized with yttria.
Dry the milled precursors in an oven at 80 °C overnight.
Calcine the combined powders at 1200 °C for 4 hours in a zirconia crucible.
Pelletize the calcined powders into disc-shaped samples using a 5 wt.% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) binder.
Sinter the pellets at 1450 °C for 4 hours at a heating rate of 2 °C per minute.
Polish the sintered pellets on silicon carbide paper.
Coat the pellets with silver paint on both sides and dry at 600 °C for 30 minutes.

reference_steps: In2Se3@SnSe S-scheme heterojunction piezo-photocatalysts were prepared using two-step hydrothermal method.
SnSe displays typical nanoplate morphology while In2Se3 exhibits nanosheet structure.
Chemical reaction involving Se in SnSe produces In2Se3 during heterojunction formation.
All In2Se3@SnSe heterojunctions exhibit flower-like spherical structure.
Varying molar content of SnSe was used to create different compositions (In2Se3@SnSe-1, In2Se3@SnSe-2, In2Se3@SnSe-3, In2Se3@SnSe-4).
Heterojunction formation results in interfacial interaction and electron transfer from SnSe to In2Se3.
Raw materials were accurately weighed according to composition (1-x)(Ba0.95Ca0.05)(Ti0.89Sn0.11)O3-xBiFeO3 and milled with ethanol for 16 h.
After drying at 100°C, powders were calcined at 1150°C for 3 h.
Calcined powders were re-milled with ethanol for 16 h.
Powders were pressed into disks of 9 mm diameter using 3% PVA solution as binder.
Green bodies were fired at 600°C for 2 h and then sintered at 1400°C for 3 h.
Sintered ceramics were polished and coated with silver paste on top and bottom surfaces.
Silver-coated ceramics were fired at 800°C for 30 min to obtain electrodes.
Coated ceramics were poled at 50 kV/cm DC field for 30 min at room temperature in silicone oil bath.
test_steps: Accurately weigh the precursors according to the composition of (1-x) (Ba0.95Ca0.05) (Ti0.89Sn0.11)O3-xBiFeO3.
Mill the precursors with ethanol for 16 hours.
Dry the powders at 100 °C.
Calcine the dried powders at 1150 °C for 3 hours.
Re-mill the calcined powders with ethanol for 16 hours.
Press the powders into disks of 9 mm in diameter using 3% PVA solution as a binder.
Fire the pressed disks at 600 °C for 2 hours.
Sinter the fired disks at 1400 °C for 3 hours.
Polish the sintered ceramics and coat with silver paste on the top and bottom surfaces.
Fire the coated ceramics at 800 °C for 30 minutes to obtain an electrode.
Pole the coated ceramics at 50 kV/cm DC field for 30 minutes at room temperature in a silicone oil bath.

reference_steps: Stoichiometric ratios of high-purity precursors BaCO3, CaCO3, ZrO2, SnO2, and TiO2 were mixed.
Combinations were ground for 2 hours in mortar and pestle.
Materials were ball milled for 4 hours in ethanol solution with zirconia balls in low-energy ball mill.
Resulting solutions were dried and obtained lumps were pulverized.
Powders were calcined for 4 hours at 1200°C in air ambient.
Resulting granulated powders were reground.
1 wt% polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) was added as organic binder.
Materials were molded into disk-shaped pellets (1 mm thick and 10 mm diameter).
Pellets were heated for 1 hour at 650°C at rate of 1°C per minute to burn off PVA binder.
Binder-free pellets underwent sintering for 4 hours at 1400°C in air.
Sintered pellets were electroded on opposite faces with conducting silver paste for electrical measurements.
test_steps: Mix stoichiometric ratios of high-purity precursors.
Grind the mixture for 2 hours in a mortar and pestle.
Mill the combinations for 4 hours in an ethanol solution with zirconia balls in a low-energy ball mill.
Dry the resulting solutions.
Pulverize the obtained lumps.
Calcine the powders for 4 hours at 1200 °C in air ambient.
Regrind the granulated powders and mold into disk-shaped pellets with 1 wt % polyvinyl alcohol as an organic binder.
Heat the pellets for 1 hour at 650 °C at a rate of 1 °C per minute to burn off the PVA binder.
Sinter the binder-free pellets for 4 hours at 1400 °C in air.

reference_steps: Mixed 1 g colemanite, 80 mg Fe2O3, 500 mg BaCO3, and 500 mg TiO2.
Subjected mixture to ball milling for 15 h at rotational speed of 300 rpm.
Added 2 mL of 13.8 M ammonia solution to mixture and ball-milled for additional 3 min at same speed.
Transferred resulting mixture onto silicon carbide plate (3 cm × 2 cm).
Evaporated ammonia solution by heating plate on hot plate set to 150°C.
Placed SiC plate with residual mixture into tubular furnace.
Gradually increased furnace temperature to 1300°C and maintained for 3 h under continuous NH3 gas flow.
Stopped NH3 gas flow at 975°C upon completion of reaction.
Allowed furnace to cool to room temperature.
Carefully removed composite material from SiC plate for characterization.
test_steps: Mix 1 g colemanite, 80 mg Fe2O3, 500 mg BaCO3, and 500 mg TiO2.
Ball mill the mixture for 15 h at a rotational speed of 300 rpm.
Add 2 mL of 13.8 M ammonia solution to the mixture and ball mill for an additional 3 min.
Transfer the resulting mixture onto a silicon carbide plate.
Evaporate the ammonia solution by heating the plate on a hot plate set to 150 °C.
Place the SiC plate with the residual mixture into a tubular furnace.
Gradually increase the furnace temperature to 1300 °C and maintain for 3 h under a continuous flow of NH3 gas.
Stop the NH3 gas flow at 975 °C and allow the furnace to cool to room temperature.

reference_steps: Raw materials CeO2, Bi2O3, TiO2, and Nb2O5 were weighed according to BTN-100xCe nominal composition.
Materials were ball mixed for 24 hours with anhydrous ethanol and zirconia balls medium.
Mixed slurries were separated from balls and dried.
Dried materials were calcined at 800°C for 3 hours.
Calcined materials were ball milled for 24 hours again and dried.
Dried powders were granulated with 5 wt% polyvinyl alcohol solution as adhesive.
Granulated powders were pressed into green pellets of 13 mm diameter and 1.0 mm thick under 120±10 MPa pressure.
Green pellets were fired at 650°C for 3 hours to burn off PVA.
Pellets were sintered at 1065-1105°C for 3 hours in air with 5°C/min heating rate.
Sintered samples were furnace-cooled to ambient temperature.
test_steps: Weigh raw materials according to BTN-100xCe nominal composition.
Ball mix for 24 h with anhydrous ethanol and zirconia balls medium.
Dry and calcine mixed slurries at 800 °C for 3 h.
Ball mill dried powders for 24 h.
Granulate dried powders with polyvinyl alcohol solution as adhesive.
Press granulated powders into green pellets of 13 mm diameter and about 1.0 mm thick under a pressure of 120 ± 10 MPa.
Fire green pellets at 650 °C for 3 h to burn off the PVA.
Sinter at 1065 °C–1105 °C for 3 h in air with 5 °C/min followed by furnace-cooling to ambient temperature.

reference_steps: Raw materials Ba(CH3COO)2, Ca(NO3)2·4H2O, Zr(NO3)4·5H2O, Ti(OC4H9)4 and La(NO3)3·nH2O were added to an Erlenmeyer flask to gain a polymer solution.
Solution was placed in the oven at 120°C for 10 h to obtain gels.
Gels were calcined at 900°C for 2 h to form precursor powders.
Powders were pressed into disks with a diameter of 20 mm.
Disks were embedded in alumina.
Disks were sintered at 1300°C for 4 h in air with a heating rate of 5°C/min.
Ceramic samples were obtained.
test_steps: Prepare the solution using the precursors.
Place the solution in the oven at 120 °C for 10 h to obtain gels.
Calcine the gels at 900 °C for 2 h to form precursor powders.
Press the powders into disks with a diameter of 20 mm.
Embed the disks in alumina.
Sinter the disks at 1300 °C for 4 h in air with a heating rate of 5 °C/min.

reference_steps: Raw materials BaCO3, CaCO3, ZrO2 and TiO2 were weighed according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Raw materials were mixed with ethanol and ball-milled for 24 h.
Ethanol-ceramic slurry was dried in an oven and ground into a powder.
Powder was calcined at 1250°C for 3 h with a heating ramping rate of 5°C/min.
Calcinated powders were ground and sieved using a mesh with a size of 63 μm.
For dense ceramics: PVA was mixed with BCZT powders as binding agent.
Mixture was uni-axially cold-compacted at a pressure of 80 MPa to form green body.
Green body was heated to 500°C for 2 h using a ramp rate of 1°C/min to burn out organic agents.
Final sintering at 1400°C for 10 h with a ramp rate of 5°C/min.
Sintered ceramics were formed into dimension with thickness of 1 mm and diameter of 10 mm.
test_steps: Weigh the raw materials according to the stoichiometric ratio.
Mix the raw materials with ethanol and ball-mill for 24 h.
Dry the ethanol-ceramic slurry in an oven and grind into powder.
Calcine the powder at 1250 °C for 3 h with a ramp rate of 5 °C/min.
Grind and sieve the calcinated powders using a mesh of size 63 µm.
For dense ceramics, mix BCZT powders with PVA, compact at 80 MPa to form green body.
Sinter the green body at 500 °C for 2 h to burn out organic agents, then at 1400 °C for 10 h with a ramp rate of 5 °C/min.
For porous ceramics, ball mill BCZT powders with deionized water, PVA, and ammonium polyacrylate to form a slurry.
Pour the slurry into a cylindrical mold and freeze at -80 °C.
Remove ice by freeze drying to form a porous BCZT green body.
Sinter the porous green bodies under the same conditions as dense ceramics.
